00040 CCedrusXidActiveDevice::CCedrusXidActiveDevice()
00041     : button_count_(0),
00042       xid_device_()
00043 {
00044 
00045 }
00046 
00047 void CCedrusXidActiveDevice::set_xid_device(
00048     boost::shared_ptr<cedrus::xid_device_t> xid_device)
00049 {
00050     xid_device_ = xid_device;
00051     xid_device_->reset_base_timer();
00052     xid_device_->reset_rt_timer();
00053 }
00054 
00055 STDMETHODIMP CCedrusXidActiveDevice::getName(BSTR *name)
00056 {
00057     if(!xid_device_)
00058     {
00059         last_error_ = L"Xid device has not been properly initialized.";
00060         return E_FAIL;
00061     }
00062 
00063     std::string dev_name = xid_device_->get_device_name();
00064     std::wstring wname;
00065     wname.assign(dev_name.begin(), dev_name.end());
00066 
00067     *name = SysAllocString(wname.c_str());
00068     return S_OK;
00069 }
00070 
00071 STDMETHODIMP CCedrusXidActiveDevice::getXYIndices(long *xIndex, long *yIndex)
00072 {
00073     // we have no axes on XID devices as of yet.  Return 0 for both xIndex and
00074     // yIndex
00075     *xIndex = 0;
00076     *yIndex = 0;
00077     return S_OK;
00078 }
00079 
00080 STDMETHODIMP CCedrusXidActiveDevice::processMessage(BSTR message, BSTR *result)
00081 {
00082     *result = SysAllocString(L"processsMessage()");
00083     return S_OK;
00084 }
00085 
00086 // According to the Presentation SDK documentation, this method is polled
00087 // at approximately 1000Hz.  Thus we use this method to poll the XID device
00088 // for responses.
00089 STDMETHODIMP CCedrusXidActiveDevice::getResponseCount(unsigned long *count)
00090 {
00091     if(!xid_device_)
00092     {
00093         last_error_ = L"Xid device has not been properly initialized.";
00094         return E_FAIL;
00095     }
00096 
00097     xid_device_->poll_for_response();
00098     std::size_t queue_size = xid_device_->response_queue_size();
00099 
00100     for(std::size_t i = 0; i < queue_size; ++i)
00101     {
00102         cedrus::response res = xid_device_->get_next_response();
00103 
00104         // as far as I can tell right now, there's no way in Presentation to
00105         // differentiate between a key press and release.  Here, we only grab
00106         // key press events from the xid device and ignre the release events.
00107         if(res.key_state == cedrus::FOUND_KEY_DOWN)
00108         {
00109             // translate the cedrus::response struct into a tagResponseInfo
00110             // struct and place it in the key press events list.
00111             tagResponseInfo info;
00112             info.buttonIndex = res.button;
00113             info.useTime = 0;
00114             key_press_events_.push_back(info);
00115         }
00116     }
00117 
00118     *count = key_press_events_.size();
00119 
00120     return S_OK;
00121 }
00122 
00123 STDMETHODIMP CCedrusXidActiveDevice::getResponseData(tagResponseInfo *data, unsigned long *count)
00124 {
00125 #undef min
00126     *count = std::min<unsigned long>(*count, key_press_events_.size());
00127 
00128     std::copy(key_press_events_.begin(),
00129               key_press_events_.begin() + *count, data);
00130 
00131     key_press_events_.erase(key_press_events_.begin(),
00132                             key_press_events_.begin() + *count);
00133 
00134     return S_OK;
00135 }
00136 
00137 STDMETHODIMP CCedrusXidActiveDevice::clearResponseData()
00138 {
00139     if(!xid_device_)
00140     {
00141         last_error_ = L"Xid device has not been properly initialized.";
00142         return E_FAIL;
00143     }
00144 
00145     xid_device_->clear_response_queue();
00146     key_press_events_.clear();
00147     return S_OK;
00148 }

00150 STDMETHODIMP CCedrusXidActiveDevice::pollAxisPositions(double *positions, unsigned long *count)
00151 {
00152     *positions = 0;
00153     *count = 0;
00154     return S_OK;
00155 }

00157 STDMETHODIMP CCedrusXidActiveDevice::pollAxisChanges(double *changes, unsigned long *count)

00160     *count = 0;
00161     return S_OK;
00162 }

00166     *error = SysAllocString(last_error_.c_str());
00167     return S_OK;
